# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the Julia code to solve this problem:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df.dt)
end
```
In this function, we use the `map` function to apply a function to each value in `df.dt`. This function extracts year and month from the date time using `Dates.year` and `Dates.month` functions respectively and returns their product as integer in format: “yyyymm”. This new column is added to the DataFrame `df`.

You can call this function like so, assuming that your `df` already has a column named `dt`:
```julia
add_yearmonth(df)
```
